intro: Origanum maru, commonly known as sweet marjoram, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are fragrant, containing essential oils that contribute to its use in culinary and medicinal applications. Origanum maru thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and herbal collections.
